choices.D: Consider the student certificate status as valid if the OCSP server is unreachable
choices.A: Reject the student certificate if the OCSP server replies that the student certificate status is unknown
choices.C: Use the OCSP URL included in the student certificate to verify the student certificate
choices.B: Not verify the OCSP server certificate

discussion.content:
A is correct.
C is not correct as ocsp-option is set to server, not certificate
A is correct P87 Study Guide

Selected Answer: A
A is correct as per page 86 to 87 study guide

Selected Answer: A
A is correct as per study guide page 86
Answer C is correct. To validate they need both URL & certificate

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

Examine the sections of the configuration shown in the output.
What action will FortiGate take when verifying the student certificate through OCSP?

An administrator has deployed multiple dual-band wireless APs in a wireless network. APs are installed at measured distances to ensure fast roaming for the clients. Multiple 2.4 GHz-only wireless clients are connecting to the network, and subsequent monitoring shows that individual AP 2.4 GHz interfaces are being overloaded with wireless connections.

Which configuration change would best resolve the overloading issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Study Guide page 450
A. enabling AP handoff can help balance the load between APs.
B. while you can adjust the handoff-sta-thresh, a value already exists. however, AP handoff must be enabled
C. you must enable the AP handoff feature on all radios on an AP.
D. the endpoints are 2.4Ghz only, so this will not help.

comments.content: load balancing has two forms. one is band steering, while the other is AP handoff. therefore, load balancing is not only possible, but is the correct solution. p450 of the Study Guide

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct. Load balancing is not possible because AP's are overloaded and frequency it's not possible to, because the clients only have hardware that support 2.4 GHz.

choices.A: Configure load balancing AP handoff on both AP interfaces on all APs.
choices.C: Configure load balancing AP handoff on only the 2.4 GHz interfaces of all APs.
choices.B: Configure a client limit on all AP 2.4 GHz interfaces.
choices.D: Configure load balancing frequency handoff on both AP interfaces.

choices.A: Trunks do not support tagged Ethernet frames.
choices.C: A trunk is a link aggregation group interface.
choices.B: By default, when connecting two FortiSwitch devices to each other, a trunk is automatically created between the switches.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about FortiSwitch trunks are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
B and C are true.

choices.D: Update the captive portal URL to use HTTPS on FortiGate and FortiAuthenticator.
choices.A: Create a new SSID with the HTTPS captive portal URL.
choices.B: Enable HTTP redirect in the user authentication settings.
choices.C: Disable HTTP administrative access on the guest SSID to enforce HTTPS connection.

questions.question_text:
A wireless network in a school provides guest access using a captive portal to allow unregistered users to self-register and access the network. The administrator is requested to update the existing configuration to provide captive portal authentication through a secure connection (HTTPS).
Which two changes must the administrator make to enforce HTTPS authentication? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
I agree B and D. https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Using-secure-authentication-HTTPS-on-a-FortiGate/ta-p/192486

Selected Answer: BD
As A and C are far-fetched and per study guide p. 367 and following pages

Selected Answer: BD
BD correct as per https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Using-secure-authentication-HTTPS-on-a-FortiGate/ta-p/192486

questions.question_text: Which two statements about MAC address quarantine by VLAN mode are true? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The device MAC address is added to the QuarantinedDevices firewall address group.
choices.C: It is the default mode for MAC address quarantine.
choices.A: The quarantined device is moved to the quarantine VLAN.
choices.D: The quarantined device is kept in the current VLAN.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A and C. Watch-out with the question #25.

Selected Answer: AC
MAC address is not added because it is VLAN mode
